adjectives.description: memorious (comparative more memorious, superlative most memorious)

entries.meaning: (of a person) having an unusually good memory
examples: He had forgotten ever writing the work until, ten years later, a memorious friend produced it in Palermo, newly refurbished by Rota.

entries.meaning: Easy to remember, often for specific reason; memorable.

examples: As a space inhabited in the present, it often houses material elements from the family's history, serving as a memorious map that describes and explains the family's genealogy and narratives of its past.
